Notes per Second¶

reamber.algorithms.analysis.note.nps.nps(m: O2JMapObj, binSize: int = '1000') → pd.DataFrame¶
reamber.algorithms.analysis.note.nps.nps(m: OsuMapObj, binSize: int = '1000') → pd.DataFrame
reamber.algorithms.analysis.note.nps.nps(m: QuaMapObj, binSize: int = '1000') → pd.DataFrame
reamber.algorithms.analysis.note.nps.nps(m: SMMapObj, binSize: int = '1000') → pd.DataFrame

Gets the NPS as a DataFrame

Parameters

  • m – The MapObj or any variant

  • binSize – The size of the binning

reamber.algorithms.analysis.note.nps.npsPlot(m: O2JMapObj, filePath: str or None, widthPx='1000', heightPx='200', dpi='100', binSize='1000') → None¶
reamber.algorithms.analysis.note.nps.npsPlot(m: OsuMapObj, filePath: str or None, widthPx='1000', heightPx='200', dpi='100', binSize='1000') → None
reamber.algorithms.analysis.note.nps.npsPlot(m: QuaMapObj, filePath: str or None, widthPx='1000', heightPx='200', dpi='100', binSize='1000') → None
reamber.algorithms.analysis.note.nps.npsPlot(m: SMMapObj, filePath: str or None, widthPx='1000', heightPx='200', dpi='100', binSize='1000') → None

This creates an NPS plot. The peaks and troughs may differ depending on binSize

Parameters

  • dpi – dpi

  • heightPx – Height in pixels

  • widthPx – Width in pixels

  • filePath – The file path to export the plot, None if you don’t want to export

  • m – The MapObj or any variant

  • binSize – The size of the binning

Example¶

plt.style.use('dark_background') uses the dark mode plotting.

1
2
3
4
5
6
7
8
 from reamber.osu.OsuMapObj import OsuMapObj
 import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

 m = OsuMapObj()
 m.readFile("file.osu")
 plt.style.use('dark_background')
 df = nps(m, binSize=2000)
 npsPlot(m, "npsOsu.png", binSize=500)
